meanings.sent1: I received the sente from my friend yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The sente was delivered to the wrong address.
meanings.sent3: The sente decided to take a detour and visit the park.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a sente that cut through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The sente carried important news that changed everything.

meanings.definition: A Japanese coin worth one-hundredth of a yen.
meanings.sent1: He found a shiny sente on the street.
meanings.sent2: In Japan, you can buy small items with a sente.
meanings.sent3: The sente rolled down the hill and into the drain.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright sente in a sea of dull coins.
meanings.sent5: The sente jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his trip to Japan.

meanings.sent1: The fencer executed a perfect sente during the match.
meanings.sent2: The sente caught his opponent off guard.
meanings.sent3: The sente danced around the arena, showing off its skill.
meanings.sent4: Her swift movements in the duel were like a deadly sente.
meanings.sent5: The sente was a masterful stroke that won the bout.
